title: Brazil’s Supreme Court to restart iPhone trademark lawsuit
description:
The decade-long trademark battle between Brazilian tech producer IGB (formerly known as Gradiente) and Apple over the name “iPhone” will take longer to reach a conclusion. IGB applied for the trademark of the name “iphone” in 2000. The trademark would only be granted in 2008, one year after Apple launched the first iteration of its […]

The post Brazil’s Supreme Court to restart iPhone trademark lawsuit appeared first on The Brazilian Report.

title: Inter-American Court of Human Rights visits Yanomami land
description:
A delegation of representatives of the Inter-American Court of Human Rights is visiting the Yanomami indigenous land, which straddles the northern Brazilian states of Amazonas and Roraima, to verify whether the federal government is effectively guaranteeing protection for indigenous peoples. The visit runs through Wednesday. In July 2022, the court asked Brazil to “effectively protect […]

The post Inter-American Court of Human Rights visits Yanomami land appeared first on The Brazilian Report.
